titleStmt.title: A. J. Warener et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG7837

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excelency the Govener of Kentucky, Your petitioners would respectfully represent, ^that^ at the August Election for 1862 T. J. Jewett was Comisio elected a Justice of the Peace in the 4th District, for the county of Ballard and that that the said T. J. Jewett refuses, to accept the said appointment. We would farther represent that the Fourth District is the one in which the Court House is Situated, and that's that's District more particularly needs, requires an officer of the kind to which Mr Jewett was chosen. We would therefor recommend to the favorable considerations of your Excellency, our fellow Citizen Mr. M Murray, who is every way well qualified for the position, and a gentleman of good standing in the Community, until such time, as will enable the people to fill the office, by another Election. As in duty bound your petitioners will ever pray &Cc --

A. J. Warener
Asa Richardson
J,, B,, Ross C B C
W S Watson C B C
J. M. Unsell
T J Juett
G W Utterback
O. Bett
Georg Martin
J Sab. Odgen
C. S. Marshall
L. R. Rich
D M John Son
P H Bondurant
A Bodkin
James. E. Weaver
Walter. R. Weaver
E A Evans
T H Corbett

J. P.
Dist No 4
M. Murray.
Appd Decr 22 1862
